p: As with all studies, possible observation error or collection bias should be considered when interpreting our results. For example, if there is inconsistent observer bias over time toward collecting individuals of a given size, or at a time of year when individuals of a certain size class are more likely to be found (Connette, Crawford, & Peterman, 2015), body size of museum specimens may not be representative of sizes found in nature (Grant, 2015). This could then be one reason why our results are inconsistent with predicted changes in size with environmental changes, so our data may in fact be missing a trend that actually exists.
